title: When were two digit phone numbers used? - Quora

response.answer_text: I was looking through some old stuff last night that my late patents had collected and kept over the years. Included was a programme for a local event in April 1939. There were lots of adverts from local companies. Any phone numbers given were mostly 3 or 4 digits, except one for a taxi company which was a 2 digit number. This is in the UK.

I answered a similar question in August. It was about one-digit phone numbers but it certainly applies to two-digit numbers. Neal McLain's answer to What country has the least amount of digits in their telephone numbers?
